text: Please read the following instructions and explanations carefully. The annotations will not be shown during the actual experiment.
data.caption: Introduction

text: A colleague has asked you to help with some code from another project.
The code is working, but it is behaving unexpectedly. Your colleague needs your help to find out why, so that he can change the implementation later on.
data.caption: Situation

text: Here you can see a function, written in C#.
The code is commented. The purpose of the function is stated in the first comment line. The other lines contain an overview of the variables that occur in the code.
data.caption: Example Code

text: Your task is to find an error in the code, but you don't have to fix it.
The code compiles correctly, but it produces faulty behavior during runtime. The function contains only one error.
The shown function is an example to illustrate what the screen looks like.
data.caption: Your Task

text: During the experiment only a couple of lines are visible, while the remaining lines are hidden.
data.caption: Visible area

text: You can move the visible area using the arrow keys on your keyboard. Move the visible area to the bottom now (by pressing the down arrow key)!
data.caption: Control

text: As soon as you are certain that you have found the error, press the space bar. A dialog will appear.
(Press the spacebar now.)
data.caption: Error found

text: When you found the error, please specify the line number it's in.
data.caption: Line Number

text: Please also give a short description of the error and explain what exactly is wrong.
data.caption: Description

text: The "Cancel" button lets you return to the code, in case you are uncertain about the error.
data.caption: Cancel

text: If you can't find the error, you can press "Surrender" as a last resort. You will then skip to the next code snippet.
data.caption: Surrender

text: In order to finish, please click the "Done"-Button.
data.caption: Completion

text: You have got at most 10 minutes to find the error. Try to find the error as quickly as possible. However, accuracy is more important than speed.
Close to the end a warning message will be shown. After the timer has elapsed, the next trial will be presented.
data.caption: Time limit

text: You will see a total of {{ number }} different code snippets.
Each snippet will take approximately 5 - 10 minutes. You can take a short break between the snippets.
data.caption: Procedure

text: To sum things up:
- Find the error that is causing the faulty behavior in the code
- Move the visible area with your arrow keys
- Press the space bar when you are certain that you found the error
- You have got at most 10 minutes per snippet
data.caption: Summary
